SEARCH
Package client.view

Class TUI

java.lang.Object
Observer.ViewObservable
client.view.TUI
All Implemented Interfaces:
View
public class TUI extends ViewObservable implements View
This class manages the initial outputs and inputs demands when the ClientApp is launched from terminal. Its functionalities include the methods to interact with the user so that he can enter his turn or see the model data of the game.

    • setNickname

      public void setNickname(String nickname)
      Description copied from interface: View

      Parameters:

      Specified by:
      setIsTurn in interface View

    • resetNeedNick

      public void resetNeedNick()
      This method is called only when the nickname has been accepted from the model and as a consequence sets the attribute needNick to false, which indicates that no more requests of a valid nickname are needed.

    • setPlayerList

      public void setPlayerList(ArrayList<Player> playerList)
      This method is called when the number of Player has reached the requested size, Sets the actual playerList of the current match.
      Specified by:
      setPlayerList in interface View
      Parameters:
      playerList - the instance of playerList of the current match

    • init

      public void init() throws InterruptedException
      This method manages the correct sequence of connection to the RemoteServer also verifying a valid nickname following the rules of the game. It runs a thread that pings in every instance the server to handle the disconnection of RemoteServer. This method keeps running until the game has reached its end.
      Throws:
      InterruptedException

    • OnVerifyConnection

      private void OnVerifyConnection()
      This method is responsible for the disconnection handling. It calls internally a method of the RemoteServer and uses a try-catch to see if there is a RemoteException

    • riprendiEsecuzione

      public void riprendiEsecuzione()
      Description copied from interface: View
      This method is used to release the semaphore. Semaphore is a variable used to control the correct execution of the flow of the method init.
      Specified by:
      riprendiEsecuzione in interface View

    • resetGameOn

      public void resetGameOn()
      Description copied from interface: View

      Specified by:
      resetGameOn in interface View

    • askPlayerNextMove

      public void askPlayerNextMove()
      Description copied from interface: View
      This method allows the user to choose between the actions to execute during the match depending on the given input on the command line. By selecting '1', the user will enter the game turn which consists in picking and putting PlayableItemTiles. The other inputs select different views of the game's database.
      Specified by:
      askPlayerNextMove in interface View

    • WriteInChat

      public void WriteInChat()
      Description copied from interface: View
      It is the method that allows the user to write a message to be sent in private or to all Players in the PlayerList of the game
      Specified by:
      WriteInChat in interface View

    • checkAddressValidity

      public static boolean checkAddressValidity(String ipAddress)
      This method check if the given input is a valid ipAddress according to the well known partition
      Parameters:
      ipAddress - is a String that should contain an ipAddress
      Returns:

    • checkPortValidity

      public boolean checkPortValidity(int portNum)
      This method checks whether the portNum suggested by the user is in the available range of socket ports of the host.
      Parameters:
      portNum - represents the port number chosen by the user
      Returns:
      true if portNum is >=1024, false otherwise
